description:
Great little bar! Really good atmosphere and super laid back. They have old movies playing that were filmed in San Francisco, which was interesting. 

I'm really only writing this review to tell you I met the best bartender I've ever seen, and I've been around. It was just fun watching her work and engage with the customers. Go see Darian (Dee), and you will never want to leave.
author: Kevin B.

description:
My boyfriend and I found this place while we were on vacation in San Francisco. We found the place on Yelp, and saw some good reviews it had so we decided to check it out, hoping they were playing the basketball game. They were playing it, so we found some seats at the bar to order our drinks. The first red flag we experienced here was the bartender. I went to the bathroom while my boyfriend ordered drinks. Immediately she told him "Just make sure you close out by 9, because that's when my shift is over. I'm heading to a new job after this and I'm gonna make bank, but want to make sure I get my tips you know?" Mind you, it was like, barely 8:15 at this time, and as customers, we didn't feel like that was an appropriate thing for her to be saying to us. We decided then that we would only order 1 drink from her.

There was a decent amount of people there, for the small space that the bar offers, and of the group of people, there was a 7-8 person group of guys that were very clearly Golden State fans, and had obviously spent a solid amount of time, and money, at this place. When the game was over, and the Warriors won, the particular group was ready to close out their tabs and move on to other places to celebrate. One guy in particular approached the bar to close out, and the bartender made a comment like, "Oh how'd you get to have only a $20 tab, you made all your friends pay for everything?" You could tell the guy was irritated by that. Fast forward about 10 minutes and he returned to the bar stating that she gave him the wrong debit card, to which the bartender then discovered that she had given his card to someone else, that had already left long before the game was over, and vis versa. The guy was pretty calm about it, considering a stranger now had his debit card, but definitely wanted an explanation and a solution. The bartender had ZERO customer service skills as she tried to tell him that "It happens all the time", "You can cancel your card and get a new one for free" and "there's no need to get mad about it." He continued to explain that he just wanted to celebrate with friends, but now his only means of money was gone. She offered him a free shot, of which he did not get to choose, another guy came out to back up the bartender. They bartenders/employees basically told the guy to the "get the F*** over it" and by the end of it, the guy left not receiving any apology or real severance for the bar LOSING his debit card.

When the group left, the male worker that jumped into the situation towards the end, was speaking with another male customer he must have already known, saying things about being ready to "throw down" with the guy and "fight him if I need to." All around just very unprofessional people at this place.

I'm not from the area, so I won't be returning here regardless, but if I was I would absolutely not go here again due to the customer service alone. The way they handled this situation was so poor - especially for people that work off tips.

Proceed with caution.
author: Nichole S.

description:
Nice little neighborhood bar. Never too crowded and they have really cool weird movies playing. The bartenders are attentive. 

Used to live in the hood and this was one of my go-to places. A good mix of locals and tourists, but mostly locals.
author: Zita M.

description: Owl Tree is a cute little bar on the corner of Post and Taylor. They have a full bar, two TV screens, about a dozen bar stools around the bar, couple of booths, and a long couch seat in the corner. The bartender was super nice and friendly. Happy hour was very reasonable, $5 draft. Location was great, great selection of drinks, watch any sport you like, and the ambience was nice. If I'm ever in town, I would definitely go back!
author: Tinah Y.

description: Came here on October 8th a little before midnight. Bartender was too busy texting on her phone to service the bar. Won't be back.
author: Macay K.

description:
Took the GF to Owl Tree last night.  Service was spot on. The bartender was Dariana. When I told Dariana that I used to work at Owl Tree in the 1990s  she flowed us the first drink.  Thanks a lot Dariana- we'll be back soon!! 
 G-d I hope I'm spelling your name right :/
author: Adam H.

description:
Awesome little spot! Very small, and definitely more lounge than dive. Staff is polite, the decor is spot on and they even decorated for the holidays. 

Prices are similar to those of bars it's style, but cheap, but not outrageously expensive. This bar will absolutely become a staple location in my SF adventures. I would absolutely recommend this quaint little spot for anyone in the area or passing through! 

Tip- if you are one of those people who bring your own canteen for water around, this place WILL fill it up for you (as long as you're a customer). I noticed that in some places in sf, they refused to fill up my water bottle and I was even kicked out of one location--NOT owl tree. They are awesome.
author: Nina A.

description: Great hot spot and the fine ass security guy on Monday and Tuesday made our visit all the more better. Always nice to be greeted with a smile when entering a business.
author: Tracey T.

description:
I've been a customer here for years but will not be spending another penny here as long as the ID checker at the door last night remains employed there. 

I can't remember the last time a bouncer was so rude to customers of a business. There's no excuse for this; I'll spend my money elsewhere.
author: Ted T.

description: On Thanksgiving 1982, I was broke & hungry with nowhere to go.  The owner, Bobby, was a friend of my pal David.  Nevertheless, Bobby welcomed me with open arms, and upstairs waiting for me was a huge, homecooked buffet spread of goodness that was fit for a King!  Plus, I was once offered $50 if I let some guy who was sitting next to me at the bar blow me, but that's another story ....
author: Cary G.

description:
As soon as we got here the bouncer told us the place could be close early than usual and he was waiting for the Bartender call to close. We arrived at 11 place supposed to close at 2am. The Asian Lady Bartender I don't know her name never introduced herself, greeting us or nothing like service standards looks like, was on her phone 90% of the time. Like she doesn't know she was working in a bar with guests. 
Horrible customer service. Never back again to this place.
author: Sabrina W.

description: Stopped by for a drink or two and it was fairly empty which isn't a bad thing around 5pm. The bartender was friendly and I sat drinking scotch. This dive bar is pretty small but worth checking out.
author: Ezell W.

description:
I love this bar. They play hip hop from the 90's and it a true bar. No reservations needed you just walk in, order a drink and sit down or hover around. 
I hate bars that are so fancy or kick you out unless you order another one of their fancy cocktails or limit your group size. I just want to grab a drink!! Is that so hard? 
This place is first come first serve. No table service and strong big pours that are reasonably priced. What more could you want from a bar? No need to dress up but come here is you want a strong drink, great music, no bs, and great atmosphere. No cover but be nice to the security outside who checks your id. Also tip your bartenders here as places like these are slowly dying out. Please help keep places like the owl tree in business. This is a great place to have a drink or two or more with friends. We need more places like this in SF!
author: Jen C.

description:
Owl Tree is a good neighborhood bar in the Tender-Nob of the city. Not to mention the bartender Zoey had girl scout cookies for her guests. Asked for a special drink and she was more than willing to try and make it. I have also been here when "Sexy" Liam and Shae are working and never had a bad time. I would recommend during HH or when the above mentioned are working.

Prices have gone up and no more High Life and I think that has scared some of the locals away from what I have heard.

When in SF, be sure to drop in for a Hoot!!
author: Joshua H.

description:
I've come here for Ashley, Lacie, Haley, Zoe, Jonathon, Carlos, and Liam in the past. This is a bar that is awesome when the right people are in place. I remember listening to very well curated play lists filled with ridiculous song a long hits from the 80s, and having stupid fun with come really awesome people.

The number of bathrooms is awesome, and I usually go for the lesser used upstairs bathroom. They've got a pretty solid back bar, and some solid classics for cocktails.
author: Zachary T.

description: Lovely neighborhood bar. Great cocktails, reasonable prices and free popcorn! Couldn't think of a better place to relax with friends in their comfortable booths and good vibes.
author: Erika H.

description:
There is an age ole tale 
Which is very hard to tell
The raves and the reviews of this place are endless
The people who work here are careless
The lady behind the counter, had no acknowledgement for guests. 
Made us wait and wait did we after reading the raves and reviews
The lady continued to serve others
And wait did we for our fancy drinks 
The lady looked at us, and excited were we get our drinks. 
Instead she waved and called us as we were some mongrel waiting for thy bone
Answered her call only to find out that she forgot what we ordered
Walked away as we met her gaze and told her to treat her customers fair. 
Wednesday was the cursed day, the lady doth not know what she is doing. 
I am off to another place, where I have more value for the drink. 

Peace!
author: Milana R.

description:
My sister and I stumbled in and out of bars all around for a couple hours until we landed on "the one". We had a blast sitting at the bar. It's an awesome location and great atmosphere. We landed us new friends from Belgium and Australia! The bartender was great. He was helpful and was friendly to put up with us cooks at the end of the bar. 

Their specialty cocktails are cheap!! The quality was amazing with rich spices. I must've had at least 4 out of the 10 available. Still need to try the others!
author: Justin W.

description:
A favorite downtown-ish afterwork spot, mostly because of the location and the staff, especially Zoe.  A nice mix of people -- locals and visitors. It's very small and can get pretty crowded quickly -- but I'm usually out of there pretty early. 

Taking off a star for the recent price hike.  I get that drink prices are up all over town, but they're starting to push it a bit.
author: Tony V.

description: Really friendly doorman and staff.  Drink menu is good. The interior has a weird feel , like a cruise ship. Dirty bathroom.
author: Heather S.

description:
Perplexed by the rave Mai Tai reviews, all mine tasted was of pineapple juice and some rum...

Seating wise is tight and not best for large parties 

Price points are fair which helps to manage expectations

Overall Thoughts

Would come back for beers but not sure about their cocktails
author: Eddie W.

description:
I would give them a negative star if I could and I am typically very generous. But what happened at this institution is abhorrent. One of my girl friends who has been a regular patron year was sexually assaulted by another patron right at the bar. When she cried out for help, the bartender looked away and pretended to not notice. While she called the cops, the bartender helped close the assailant's card and even fist bumped him! What kind of an establishment is this? I get that bars can't control the behaviour of scum bags that walk in, but looking away encourages that kind of attitude and attracts more low lives. Needless to say there was a camera that recorded this offence and justice will be served! 
Ladies, avoid this establishment at all costs!
author: Trisha H.

description:
I just visited this bar last night 4/20/17 for the first time. My experience was great inside. However the security for no reason at all was such a smart A**. Said rude comments that did not need to be said. He was an Asian security guard. I am my group of 7 people didn't want to stay because of that. But we thought of giving the bar a shot. We did and we liked the bar inside. However the security guard was out of line. I was the one who approached him and I did not come with any attitude or being negative. He was simply out of line. Won't go there again. Anyway owl tree I would take a look at that. 

CO
author: Cesar O.

description: Horrible service !!! Asian girl behind the counter just stared and refused to say hello or help us brown chick behind the bar also didn't acknowledge us. Every time we tried to go up to the bar and order they were "out" of 1-2 ingredients needed for our drinks , we then tried to order a cognac ... they were also "out" we finally concluded that these people don't want our business and they can care less if this establishment builds a horrible customer service rep. Well I'm letting all my southern calif. friends to AVOID THIS PLACE at all costs. Considering that the customer service industry is struggling and they're in a city with much competition they should take their business more seriously.  DONT waste your time or money here !!!
author: Isabel B.

description:
Ever feel the need to burrow on in to a cozy, dark, intimate spot and knock back a few beverages? Owl Tree might be your spot. 

It took me many visits over many years to figure out what exactly is going on here. You can tell this place used to be a dive bar simply by the setup. It's tiny inside, but has been gussied up with nice, dark wood, comfy-enough seats, a cool bar, and decent liquor selection. The cocktails on the menu don't reach up to craft-cocktail level, but they're adequately nicer than what you'd find in a dive. And the bartenders are friendly and familiar enough to give you that solid neighborhood bar feel. Which is a good thing. It's a lot more simple and straightforward than I gave it credit for. 

The more I stop in, the more I enjoy this spot. No pretense, no bullshit, no fake-y hipster dive scene (which means less obnoxious people)... So there's an absence of things to dislike. And what's to like? My drinks taste good, the booze is relatively inexpensive for the quality and the locale. It's not cheap, strong well swill, but I prefer not to drink that shit anyway. I can get mid-shelf here and not pay exorbitant prices for it. I like. 

Recently met a friend here for a pre-dinner cocktail and it did not disappoint. Bartenders engaged in friendly banter. Felt like a version of Cheers where nobody really knows my name but it doesn't matter because people are cool. If only Woody Harrelson were there. 

I guess you can't have it all.
author: Don B.

description:
I came here last night (Wednesday) with my cousins. And from the moment I walked in: I was in love. I wasn't quite sure how the drinks would rank in comparison to this stunning space. 

It's very dim and dark, yet very cozy and has a classic feel, very timeless. The photos posted on YELP don't do any justice. Go see it in person: it's a stunner. The crowd was more of my preference: no loud obnoxious people, and no wannabe hipsters, and rowdy college kids. We were the youngest crowd there, but we didn't feel out of place. There was another younger crowd who were slightly obnoxious just a tad for a moment, but you don't even notice with the setup. It wasn't overwhelmingly crowded, it's a small space and the areas filled up, but nothing crowded.. super loungy: makes you want to be here for awhile. I could imagine writers and other creative folk from the past going to a place like this just to unwind. 

We were confined in our own cozy nook at the end where we enjoyed the drinks we ordered with some perfectly complimentary popcorn (mix of mostly stale but some crunchy ones which paired well with the drinks, some of the popcorn had a spicy aftertaste that was a delightful surprise.)

I had my first mule ever and it was great although it wasn't your typical moscow mule. I loved how the drink 'My Mule' was one where you could customize it, so I got it with whiskey. I asked my cousin on his opinion since he's had mules before and he said it was right on. And my pineapple mojitio was great as well. The Mai Tai here is pretty strong though: not my cup of tea. The shot of whiskey was lovely, but I learned I don't like plain whisky unless it's cinnamon whiskey. My cousins got drafts and shots (combo) as well and they seemed to enjoy it. All our drinks were made by this one bartender and she did a fantastic job.

I felt like the drinks were reasonably priced. 

And the best part: they had 80s-90s music on and.. the playlist was just perfect.
author: Lilian L.

description: Small place, really cute. Drinks are stroooong! Had blood orange margarita and pineapple mojito, both really good. Then we tried Mai Tai's and they were so strong we had to ask the bartender to top it off with more juice. Can't complain about drinks being too strong though!
author: Shondra M.

description:
TL;DR - Mayhaps better back in its hey-day, but Saturday night was a miss for me.

Crowded and dark and dirty. Saturday night and there was only ONE bartender and one waitstaff. 

There is such a weird mix of patrons here.... unfortunately, we were sitting next to a rowdy couple who ruined any ambience that Owl Tree had to offer. 

The drinks could use some work and maybe a clearer... direction of the lounge? Weird old movie playing on the TV and the seats were sticky.... More of a pub feel than a lounge feel. Yeah.
author: Crystal Z.

description: This had been favorite for a long time. The bartenders were great, the regulars were fun, and then I took a break and dried up for a month. Now I'm back and... No Lacey, no DeeDee, no Amanda, no Liam, and none of the regulars. The bar backs are gone, drinks take longer and are, no reflection on the bartender since it's a time issue, less friendly. Gonna hafta relocate, I suppose.
author: Chris S.

description: Very fun easy bar! Loved the atmosphere and the drinks were great! We got there around 7-7:30 on a Saturday and it was very laid back and quickly found a place at that the bar! The bartender was very friendly and quick to assist us and answer questions. Around 8 it got very busy and crowded. Overall it was a great place to get a drink and hangout.
author: CarolAnn W.

description: Drinks were good, but they were pretty weak. Bartender wasn't the friendliest person or really talkative at all. Cool atmosphere and vibe though.
author: Sarah W.

description: Love the way it looks outside, definitely makes you want to take a peak inside. Music was great and vibe is very relaxed and welcoming.
author: Vanessa M.

description:
Extremely Bad service!!!!! Douche bag bartender was very rude and yelled at me for not having cash. Credit card machine was down but didn't mention that till after the drinks were served. 

I come here several times a month with my company and always stay around the corner at the Clift. Never again am I coming here and telling all my coworkers and clients never to come here as well. 

Left with 2 rounds of free drinks though. Thanks!!!
author: Everett M.

description: What a cool little bar in the TenderNob. Been meaning to hang out in this neighborhood more and stumbled upon this place with friends. I'd say this place is a mix of locals and out-of-towners, and as such a lot of the local attitude you'd find at places in the Mission or NoPA doesn't exist here. People want to have a good time and as a result it's a great place to meet people. The interior is a slight notch up from your usual dive bar and service is quick. Hipsters and the uber young may not be attracted to this place and that right there is reason to come hang out if you've outgrown that phase in your life, or just want a change for a night.
author: Brian J.

description: Super cute place to grab a quick drink. It is a little smaller than expected and ideal for a group of 4 or less. The decor is a little old school but still quaint and charming! Great place to grab a drink while you wait for your table at Ryoko's.
author: Rachel N.

description:
My family and I had a great night at Owl Tree while in San Fran for the night. We were able to get a table and ordered from the bar. We ordered a variety of beers and cocktails over the course of a few hours, and I really enjoyed all of my drinks (I had The Greyhound- which was very refreshing and not overly sweet).

My only complaint would be that the service was a bit slow for a weekend evening, as there was only one bartender for the entire bar. The bar back/bus boy also would make drinks for a handful of people, but not for others, which I found odd.

The Owl Tree is a bit of a dive and definitely not "my scene", but we stayed until last call and I really enjoyed my drinks.
author: Morgan C.

description: Went to Owl Tree recently, gotta say it was awesome for the location. Staff were welcoming and attentive when ordering drinks. Overall nice place to engage in conversations, while still having that lively environment!
author: Keith Q.

description:
Came here on Christmas day after meeting a couple at Lefty's....they tipped the bartender, Liam to make his day. We piled on top as well.

Left my jacket...called from the cab and they confirmed they had it. Called many times afterwards to get it and kept getting the run around....tried sending people to get it and they claimed the manager had it locked up.

Just spoke to Lacy the manager who claims it is no longer there and gave me crap for waiting a month. I didn't wait a month, I could never get anyone to say they had it after Liam...

Super pissed, don't go to this place...
author: Mike R.

description: We are visiting from out of town , and found this gem... Liam is an awesome bartender and has an great personality. Will definitely stop by again next time we are in SF...
author: Sherry B.

description: Great place.  A great "craft drink dive bar"... yes, I coined that phrase and Owl Street is the stand out.
author: Mark W.

description: Horrendous female bartender, bad attitude with anyone under 45. Okay drinks, but don't make up for the atmosphere
author: Amanda R.

description:
Looking for a place to watch the game or waiting for a table at a nearby restaurant? Owl Tree is the place to go. From beer to cocktails, they've got it all and they do it well. We ordered the Moscow Mules when we stopped in and got to watch the Warriors game with the crowds. Service is quick, it's not overcrowded and they give you popcorn with your order (huge bonus cause I was starving).

Overall, if you want to watch a sports game at a classic American Bar,  Owl Tree is it!
author: Aletta B.

description: Very cool and casual neighborhood bar with a lot of character and well crafted cocktails. If I lived in the area it would be a regular hangout spot.
author: Barry S.

description:
This is a cozy little bar with a dive bar feel. There are only a few little booths and high tops, or you can sit at the bar. The beer selection was pretty good and relatively cheap. During happy hour, in particular, prices are excellent for the location.

I stopped by after work on a Tuesday with an old friend and had a great time! I was surprised to find a bar like this in the area but was very pleased. When I arrived around 6pm the bar seating was nearly full but there was an open booth just waiting for us. The bar started getting busier shortly afterward. 

Ps. Fun fact, they don't sell food so allowed us to bring in a pizza.
author: Helen G.

description:
This place is the best option for drinks in this area on a Monday our Tuesday night.

Bartender was cool and quick. Full bar and plenty of draft beer.
author: Brendon D.

description:
I love my friends when they show me cool places in the city. I love them more when they cool places have happy hour. (Yes, my love for my friends depend on happy hour deals...)

Owl Tree is awesome in a couple of different ways:
- Located close to Union Square aka it's not in a sketchy area
- Happy hour from 4pm-6pm
- Happy hour deals: $4 draft beers and $5 well drinks 
- $10 Jameson shot with a beer
- Cheese, salami, and crackers... for free! 
- Has a TV if you want to watch games after work
- Awesome (friendly, attentive, and fun to chat with) bartenders

Owl be back!
author: Christine S.

description:
I have a friend that has lived in San Francisco for 14 years, and THIS is the first bar he ever visited here. This is a lowkey bar to share all your secrets with friends, bring a date, or just enjoy one of the many incredibly strong & delicious drinks on your own. 

The first one I tried was the Blood Orange Margarita ($10) because how do you see that on a menu and NOT be curious to try such a tasty sounding beverage? And tasty it was. My other favorite is the Effen Vodka Cucumber Gimlet ($9) which is super simple but strong. The Fresh Tito's Greyhound ($10) and Mango Mojito ($9) weren't my favorite, but that's just because I like to taste the alcohol in my drinks. 

It's almost amazing how many different types of seating they managed to cram into such a small bar, but it's cozy and I like it. Owl Tree, you have definitely made a regular out of me. I'll be back!
author: Stefanie C.

description:
Two Words: Mai Tai's.
The Best! I literally sit at home thinking of how tasty this drink. No one has come close to making this wonderful concoction like Owl Tree does. Throw in an awesome bartender, Zoe, and you got yourself an amazingly chill night. 
So what have we learned? Go see Zoe and request the all powerful Mai Tai!
Oh.... And their bathroom is super clean. Who doesn't love a clean bathroom?!
author: Kelly T.

description: Lame. Ordered a drink at 140 am before last call and when the bar ostensibly closes at 2. The bouncer came in a minute after we ordered, told everyone they had 2 minutes to finish or he would take their drinks. He forced everyone out at 1:48, making us abandon the drinks we paid for. Reinforced the general atmosphere of scumminess I felt when I entered.
author: G C.

description:
I love this place. It's dark and cozy, great cocktails, good vibe. I will definitely go back. 

I was with a group of 5 people and we had dinner at La Colonial and popped in here for after dinner drinks. We sat in the back booth, the staff was attentive, the bathroom was clean, good decor, good music, fun classy crowd. My only mini complaint is that it was hot and stuffy, the air flow was lacking, but it was a warm day and it's an old building. I will go back for sure!!!
author: Sarah S.

description: Above-average find in the area between Union Square and Nob Hill. While it might look like a dive bar from the outside, the interior feels just classy enough to avoid the divey feeling, yet the prices are quite reasonable (particularly at happy hour) and the selection of drinks and cocktails quite decent. Depending on the time of day, the crowd here can vary widely, from people grabbing drinks after work to visitors staying at nearby hotels and a wide cross-section of locals. A nice atmosphere all around.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Very cool corner bar spot. We had one more round before hitting the theater. Popped in, very friendly bartender, made our drinks and had a great experience.

Seemed very clean, not super loud, decent prices, and clean bathroom... Not much more to ask for.

There is a jukebox, atm, and tv's.
author: Drew P.

description: Cool place to hang.  Small but comfortable and dim but inviting. The interior and decor gives a very nice classy atmosphere for a night out with a few friends or on a date, and their drink/cocktail selection make things even better, not to mention friendly and professional staffs who are attentive. Well done. See you all next time!
author: HW Y.

description:
I have to start out with the fact that this place has a special place in my heart. I always come here and I always have a fantastic time. The drinks are average price, but they also have some drink specials. My favorite is the shot of Jameson and a beer combo. How can you say no to that?

The bartenders and customers are all really friendly, welcoming, and just plain awesome! The first time I came here this woman was having a Birthday (sash and all) and she bought a roll of shots for everyone around her. It was awesome! Those are the kind of people that come in here and thats what makes me keep coming back.

It is a great neighborhood bar that has great atmosphere and vibes. I love this place! And it doesn't hurt that they give out free cheese, salami, and crackers too!
author: Theo T.

description:
*swoon*

This is my go-to dive when in this part of town.  It is on the edge of Union Square and the "Loin", so you don't get a crowd from either region.  Rather it is very eclectic, maybe from the neighboring hotels, or service industry peeps.  But it seems everyone here knew of its confines.  Not many random hit-ups.

I seem to have missed the original incarnation of owl memorabilia strewn about, but what we have now still revels in true dive form.  Dark, soft lighting.  Awesome music, mostly from the 80's.  When Prince's "Controversy" comes on, that is an open invitation to plop my rear in one their "coffee table" spots, and definitely have a few.  They have Four Roses Bourbon, son!

And they had one of the "Dirty Harry" flicks on loop, so you can reminisce on what SF looked like back in the day...when China Basin didn't have the ball park, nor the high rise condos.  Pure dive bar entertainment.
author: D.wight L.

description:
I do not recommend this bar!  I was in there with a group of friends and everything seemed great.  I went to the bar to get a drink and a man the age of at least 65 grabbed my butt.  I pushed him off of me and told him that was inappropriate. The bouncer clearly saw this occur bc he walked up and told the man "you have to leave".  I assumed this was under control. I then noticed that the man was allowed to stay in the bar.  I told the bouncer that he should have kicked that man out and his response was "i know, but..."

My friend and i saw the man was the. Outside and allowed to reenter the bar bc according to the bouncer "he had to go to the bathroom".

In my opinion this behavior is inappropriate and unacceptable.
author: Aly M.

description:
That place is very dark cozy and full of rambunctious intoxicated tourists and locals fresh from their cubicles it was noisy crowded and two yuppie couples got into a spat over a dog near the door so I slammed down my house wine and left I would go there again because it's down the street from the Commonwealth club which I am a member. I visited there a few months ago and just got around to remembering to review them today. 

Considering what she had to work with the lady bartender was very pleasant.
author: SF T.

description: Had a couple Jameson myles during happy hour on a Friday night. Bartender was on it while we were switching seats to make room for smaller parties. The space is adequate for the area and actually debated about coming back after we checked out but was a little late. Good selection on drinks and the atmosphere was perfect after a long week to whined down. Quick, easy and definitely stopping by next time I am in the area!
author: Alina C.

description:
The bouncer was the best! So friendly and the staff is super funny. 

The music selection was (dare I say) LIT. 80's and RnB classics. AMAZING. 

Drinks are decently priced. And it's very clean and warm inside.
author: D T.

description:
As far as dives are concerned, this one feels far less "divey" than most. When I'm in this area of San Francisco, I usually expect any bar slapped with the "dive" label to be some sort of dilapidated homage to a formerly great establishment, complete with a bar lined with characters you couldn't make up if you tried. 

Not that that's a bad thing. But Owl Tree surprised me - pleasantly - in a different way. The dark wood interior and comfortable booths were homey and a welcome escape from the cold night air. The bartender, while stone-faced and serious, was attentive and quick to offer a refill. And the patrons were mostly young folks like me who all seemed to be there just to try something new.  

Don't get me wrong. This is still a dive. The low prices, relatively cheap drinks and scattered bowls of party mix say as much. But it's a dive with a special vibe, and for that reason I'll be returning on a future SF visit.
author: Alex L.

description: First night is San Fran... must hit up this bar! The drinks were good, bartenders were fast & friendly! My drink wasn't "weak"... which was nice for once. Worth every penny. Nice place if you just wanna sit down and chill.
author: Jordyn P.

description: Super chill bar. Small but a good pit stop for a drink or two.
author: Diego C.

description:
A great little dive bar to visit after shopping in Union Square. The drinks are inexpensive and strong. If you are drinking a Jameson's and Ginger you don't want them weak. On this Saturday Santa Con was occurring and there were quite a few Santa's getting there drink on. Who was the Santa Claus in the sequin hot pants?

We were also waiting for the 6:00 pm opening of Ryoko to eat some Sushi. Dark woods and mirrors, no juke box or pool tables, just a drinking establishment with special drinks...Greyhounds anyone. Forget it...go for the whiskey and bourbon drinks
My female friends were impressed by the bar tenders and bouncers. 

I'm glad we were able to grab a seat because it was crowded...
author: Jim D.

description: Amazing, kind of hole-in-the-wall bar. The bartenders were amazing, made conversation and made the drinks decently strong. Would honestly suggest to anyone looking for a "quieter" place to get a drink or 2.
author: Bree M.

description:
Brought some friends here that were in town for a conference, and whose hotel was walking distance.

It was a Thursday night and we couldn't find much room to stand or a table for us to sit.  We tried to stand near the door area, but that was apparently a fire hazard according to the guy at the door, so we just awkwardly stood further in next to a table.

After about 15-20mins a table became vacant, and we were able to sit comfortably and talk together.  About 30mins later we decided to leave as our group grew by about 3 more people and apparently we were causing a fire hazard by too many of us being right at the doorway again.

I do not think the place is too great for larger groups, but smaller ones; i.e. 3-4, would work out fine.  If I go back, it'll definitely not be with so many people.  I'll probably have a better experience here that way.
author: Pia V.

description: It was Sunday night and my buddy and I walked by Owl Tree and sneaked a peek. "That's my kinda bar" he says, and I reply "me too!". Apparently, dim bars with senior patrons are something I did not know we both have an affinity for. It's a good think we took a minute to drink. My friend recommended Four Roses whiskey and I think I might have found my new go-to. My previous go to is Powers (yeah, I'm classy) and I had that right after to do a sip and compare. So, I walked out of Owl Tree much more experienced and having gained a valuable life experience.
author: Nate R.

description:
Came in for happy hour before I had to catch a flight. It's a bit off the beaten path, so if you don't necessarily know where you're going, you may end up lost (or in a less savory part of town). The interior is very chill -- the dim lighting invites you to relax. And with $3 beer on their happy hour menu, and a free cheese and salami plate with crackers, I wasn't going to complain.

Boyfriend and I snagged a private little corner booth and sat back, sipping our beers and listening to the 50s music they were playing. I also got several little plates of the cheese, salami and crackers because I was hungry and no one stopped me.

The bartenders weren't pushy, didn't give off the feeling that we needed to buy more than our one beer apiece in order to feel welcome. Just let us enjoy ourselves and cleaned away our glasses unobtrusively when we were done. Very relaxed. I would come back with some more friends to hang out for a drink or two!
author: Anna W.

description: I love dive bars.  Especially dive bars with happy hour, personable bartenders, sports on two flat screen TVs and delicious specialty cocktails to wet your whistle.  And I have to love a place with the word "owl" in the name of course.  Stopped by on a whim while waiting for some friends, had some of the "pub mix" (which I'm pretty sure is the Cheez It party mix with pretzels etc in it) but nonetheless free with our drinks.  Took advantage of the happy hour and also tried the blood orange margarita (yum!).  Worth stopping by and checking out!
author: Reena P.

description:
Stop by for happy hour tuesdays with some chex mix and meats & cheese.  

...I'm sure that's what most people need to know about this place. Otherwise, it's a cool little bar I tend to frequent when waiting for some sushi at Sakana next door. It's a mixed bag when it comes to bartenders. The guys are always nice - ok, yeah maybe it's because I am a girl, but the female bartender we see every once in a while doesn't give us the time of day, as though we won't tip just as good as the guys you need to chat up. Either way, it doesn't really matter to me. Make my drink and I'm all good.
author: Leina K.

description: Fun bar with great music.  Drinks are fresh.  Good HH.  The bartenders are informative with local knowledge.  It's a good time.  Old school bar with little frills.
author: Andrew C.

description: Very cool.  Very mellow.  Very old school.  Suits and ties enjoying Happy Hour.  Exposed brick walls, cool lighting, good drinks.  It was a nice surprise for me.  SF is full of surprises!  Can't wait to check this place out again.
author: Thomas D.

description: Fun music, good wines and great drinks. Nice atmosphere and friendly bartenders. Definitely a place to stay all night and come back to again and again.
author: Paula R.

description: Great little bar with no stress or wannabe superstars and good mix of tunes!! Happy bar staff, cocktails at $11 , plays sport ...
author: Brett H.

description:
Rip off joint. We will never go again. We go in sometimes before we head to A.C.T.( we have season tickets) but this evening was our final time. Sour faced Asian female came on & prices went up, plus she gave us the wrong drink. Don't worry, we will never be back, plenty of other places nearby.
She blamed the hike on not being happy hour anymore, however we were never charged that much on our previous visits. I think, once she heard an accent, ( I have one), she decided we were dumb tourists & wanted to rip us off. Travelers, beware. Unless you like being ripped off.
author: Margaret D.

description:
"Unexpected find" is a great way to describe Owl Tree. What will likely happen is a friend will drag you here. Upon looking at it from the outside, you will say "Not another Tenderloin dive bar." You will hope there is not sawdust on the floor, which was quirky the first time and gross upon further reflection. 

Instead you shall find a surprisingly classy interior with good seating, reasonable prices and sturdy drinks. A friend gave me her Manhattan, it was a Manhattan. How anyone can taste anything besides the whiskey is beyond me, but people "in the know" said it was a good one. I ordered a Moscow Mule (delicious) and a margarita. The margarita was, of course, for a less manly friend than me. But if I did drink that margarita, I would say it was fruity and boozy without being overwhelming in sweetness or alcohol. 

Overall, a good find and somewhere I would certainly take a date I don't want to spend too much money on.
author: Jake B.

description:
This is a nice, unexpected find, somewhat off the beaten path in the Union Square area. We came in on a Sunday evening, and found it to be not very crowded, and welcoming. Our bartender was friendly and made our drinks promptly.

As I get older, I find myself being more drawn to bars that are less noisy, more comfortable, and intimate. The Owl Tree offers just this atmosphere. I would come back.
author: Sonia M.

description: I really like this place for its atmosphere. It's nice bit not too nice, the staff were great and it was just small enough to feel cozy without being cramped. I like this place on slow nights to have a relaxing drink or to take a casual date to.
author: Mark D.

description: Great little bar to catch a drink and listen to some older hit songs. Try the pineapple mojito
author: David F.

description: We needed a place to kill some time on a Friday evening and decided to check this place out. What a find! Beautiful 'old-San Francisco' ambiance, clean, well stocked with premium liquors and very friendly bartenders. Zoe was so much fun and her counterpart (I didn't get his name) makes THE BEST Manhattan we have ever had. They even use the brandied cherries as opposed to those horrible marichinos. First class cocktail for a very reasonable price. The freshly popped pop corn bar snack was a great touch. I look forward to coming back soon!
author: Mary C.

description:
My friend and I were visiting San Francisco and staying pretty close to this place. We decided to stop in one evening for some drinks after a long day of walking and sightseeing.

My first impression was that "dive bar" isn't really an accurate description. I kind of expected the place to be more run down, but it's actually pretty cool inside. I guess the classification comes from the cheap drinks offered.

We had a few different beers. The bartender was really friendly and talkative which is always a plus. They had a few TVs which were showing a movie (it was completely random in a bar) and the music was mostly 90s (not necessarily a bad thing).

While it was pretty laid back when we were there, we did pass the bar a few nights later on a Friday and it looked packed. Definitely seems like a popular spot.
author: Brandon F.

description: Great service! The bartenders are very attentive and make great tasting drinks! They have all kinda of house drinks. This bar is very chill, great place to have a nice conversation. They play great music and the decoration is very nice! Owls everywhere! :p
author: Soraya F.

description:
Went there late night after dinner, it wasn't crowded. 

This place is like your small around the corner bar. The bar tender and the service is also good. If you happen to be in that area and need a late nite drink , visit them.
author: A. D.

description: I liked this bar . It has a really nice feel to it. Moe is a nice bouncer and the bartender was really nice. She didn't ask me to tip her unlike a lot of other Bars, so she was given a tip. I'll come back again for sure since my favorite restaurant is right across the street.  It is a bar that isn't trying to be something that it isn't. A lot of bars try and put up a fake front but not Owl Tree I respected what they brought to the table a nice simple atmosphere.
author: Kyle R.

description: Nice bar! Small and cozy...drinks are not overpriced and the bartender is sweet.
author: Munazzar T.

description: A great spot to grab a drink before dinner. There's nothing really special about the drinks there but the crowd always seems friendly and not your typical Polk street or Marina kinda of crowd. Don't order mixed drinks here. Be safe and stick with the ordinary beer and wine if you don't want to pay 12 dollars for a surprised gin and tonic
author: Alui L.

description:
After flirting with a guy through text for a while, he suggested we meet up. He gave me two choices, both of which I had never been to, so I told him to choose his favorite. He chose Owl Tree. 

Looking it up on Yelp, it seemed like a great place to grab a drink and it's a really decent neighborhood to be in. After showing up and noticing the great owl decor (which some of my friends would love), I enjoyed a great Blood Orange Margarita, possibly several of them. 

Cute location and decor, great drinks.
author: Nina Y.

description:
nice (dark) cozy little bar... 2 Jamison on tap, 1 patron silver, 1 blue moon - happy hour - oh i was happy! i was so happy that i forgot to try their complimentary cheese & salami & crackers! boooo

I'd definitely go back again if i am in town and around the hood.
author: Bonnie Y.

description: Stopped at the Owl Tree to meet some people for drinks. The place isn't big and was crowded, but still very customer friendly. I got ID'd going in which is great because I just turned 30. Bartender was really nice and met some interesting patrons while inside. Definitely a throwback place to the old days with a lounge type feel to it.
author: Joshua C.

description:
Why won't that owl stop looking at me. Seriously I pass this place nearly every day and its always there. Staring at me. Always. 

Besides the scary owl the Owl Tree is actually a great after work or industry night type place to check out. Be forewarned you should only go here if you are looking for an intimate time with friends or a stranger at the bar. This place is tiny! Seriously there might be living rooms out there that are bigger than this but sometimes that all you want when getting a drink. 

Inside it actually really upscale and trendy. There is a bar immediately when you enter and to the left are tables and chairs and a vip type reservation area. We were able to get a party of 10 people at one of the tables but that takes some advanced scouting. 

There is a reason most of the reviews for this place are so short and that's because there really isn't much to it. Decent drinks and cocktails, limited seating but its about the people you are here with not about the location and as a bar it does a great job of actually being a bar. Just watch out for that damn owl.

Pro Tip: There is another damn owl across the street from owl tree just look up when you exit. They are everywhere.
author: Nick R.

description:
Owl Tree is usually our second stop from Bourbon and Branch...

we love the decent prices.. we love the vibe..and it's just awesome!

Their security guy looks like a gorgeous version of Kanye West. no joke.

There are only so much seats at the tables...but you can always befriend the couple who seem to be on their very first date to scoot in a seat ---NO JOKE.. that's seriously what I did... And i was right! they were on their first date! amazeballs.

Good vibe bar!!!! Keep those Fireballs coming...and Patron...
author: Monica H.

description: Excellent clean dive bar. Booth and stools, exposed brick, looks classic. The service and happy hour. Always great music playing, whether it's classic rock or rap. Also, get a bowl of their spicy popcorn.
author: Andrew D.

description: Cozy and nice seating but once it got busy it was very difficult to get a drink. We left and brought our money elsewhere.
author: Bethany B.

description:
A quaint little bar off of Union Square with cozy little nooks for good conversation over happy hour. Yes that's Owl Tree. 

You can't miss the owl mosaic out front as you walk up Taylor street. That should be a sign for you to hang a left and pay the friendly bartenders here a visit. Happy hours end at 7pm which feature $3 beers and $4 wells. They also have a spread of sliced meats, cheeses, and crackers during HH. How thoughtful and hospitable right? I'm always comfortable at the bar but my favorite spot is the corner nook where you can have your own intimate space with your friends. 

I like the Owl Tree for the laid back vibe that is perfect for happy hour. If you find yourself wondering off Union Square looking for a libation, feel free to stop in.
author: Jon L.

description: Happened in here as it was one of the few bars open at 4pm. The bartender was friendly, and she made kick ass drinks. Was a well spent hour at the bar.
author: Amy O.

description:
The service at this place is great.  What an awesome little gem in the middle of San Francisco urban chaos.  There's nothing amazing about the selection, but it's cozy, the people are friendly, and it seems like a local hangout, which makes everything seem so much more legit.

Full bar plus a few beers on tap.  The clincher is the pint plus shot special.   A beer with a shot of Jameson was basically keeping my co-worker alive during the last week we were working in SF, and at ten bucks, that's a steal you won't find anywhere else in the bay area.

Definitely will be back.
author: Benjamin E.

description:
Happy hour at owl tree 4-7pm.

I came here cause I was looking for a happy hour place at 6:30. Lucky me! $3 drafts, $4 wells, and $1 off drinks. Alright, standard right? Not! Not only was I served right away by this beautiful friendly bartender who greeted me promptly with her happy hour specials even at 6:50pm, they upped the smile on my face with a bowl of party mix and had two trays of cheese, crackers, and sliced meats. Plus, the games are on :) NICE!

It's a great way to kick back and have some beers, listened to good old school jams and munch on snacks before dinner. Definitely coming back for happy hour again!
author: Mary C.

description:
We stopped in for a drink here on a Sunday night before heading to dinner in Chinatown. It was a block from our hotel and I found it on Yelp. After my boyfriend read that they make blood orange margaritas he was fixated on making a pit stop here. So off to Owl Tree we went!

The blood orange margarita was everything we expected and more. Very delicious and not too sweet. I went for a standard gin and tonic and had no complaints.

This bar has a very intimate neighborhood feeling. I'd say partly because it is very small and partly due to the decor. This atmosphere was quickly shattered when we left the bar and remembered we weren't in the best of areas. But you can't exactly hold that against Owl Tree.
author: Audrey P.

description:
We stopped in here whilst waiting for our table at Ryoko because it's just up the road. 

We managed to get a booth just on the inside of the door and ordered two Blue Moon's at the bar.

The bartender wasn't that friendly, but the service was efficient and the beer was cheap (compared to UK standards at least!)

Seems quite chilled out in there (which is a pleasant change for 9pm on a Friday) and would probably go again - especially when waiting for a coveted table at Ryoko.
author: Hannah B.

description:
Well, I just spent a half an hour watching Youtube videos about all the different kinds of gimlets out there, and it was inspired by my trip to Owl Tree. Any place that sparks your imagination or curiosity like this just has to be worth a visit, right?

What's to say? As a non-drinker I've got low demands of bars. Be comfy. Be kind. Be cool. And Owl Tree delivered on all of those fronts. We nabbed a corner and sat down all together in our group. Not a feat that would be so easy on a busy evening, but on this weeknight it was perfectly achievable and allowed us to enjoy our evening.

The gimlets. Well, they seem to be the drink of choice. Cucumber gimlet, to be precise. Baby kangaroos are called joeys, baby goats are called kids. Even though baby owls are called owlets, I'd like to submit that we all start calling them gimlets. It's just cuter. And more refreshing.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
All around pleaser. They use Bulleit for whiskey drinks and don't short customers. Fair among many SF bars. 

Try it out!
author: Braxton C.

description: Atmosphere is awesome. Drink was weak. Very weak. Jamison and ginger ale. Difficult time tasting the Jameson and most bars I have to request extra ginger ale. At 8 dollars a pop I expect better.
author: Laura O.

description:
I used to love coming here with my bf. The cute little sassy girl who always recognized us and treated us like family isn't there anymore and has been replaced by a Russian guy. He's not as friendly and barely acts like we exist when we go there - so we have found another neighborhood stop off place. We walk by every night after work and now won't stop in unless someone else is bartending - which seems to be never. Sorry, but there are just too many bars around the area where we are treated like the bartender is happy to see us.

I do miss your Chex Mix and salami platter :)
author: Noneya B.

description: Been here about every time I've been in San Francisco and it always a great lively place for a late night drink.
author: Fritz M.

description:
I like this place.  Its a perfect spot to wait if you're in line at Ryokos.  The drinks are cheap, and there is a decent cocktail menu, even if they arent the best in town.

Class interior and they always have some great 90s songs going whenever I'm there.  Oh and snacks, they also have great snacks.  

Its a little gem in the rough in those parts, and I approve.
author: Julie B.

description: Cool corner bar that was next to a good sushi restaurant Sakana.  Great vibe, feel good bar and nearby our hotel.   Drinks were mixed well and reasonably priced.  Bartender was friendly, courteous and attentive with our drinks.  I'm a fan and next time we're in town we'll be back.
author: Eddie C.

description: Love that this place is so down to earth and chill. It's a perfect place to go to when you need a break from shopping. The free cheese, salami, and crackers doesn't hurt either!
author: Giao L.

description: nice spot! wandered in here while waiting for an appointed down at the apple store. Friendly service, not too crowded, not too loud, and they were playing a Cardinal's game which made this guy from St. Louis happy. would definitely pop back in if I'm ever in the area.
author: Andy H.

description:
Owls make good gimlets. 

Skip everything on the cocktail menu, but the gimlet. That's some good cucumbery shit, right there. Everything else is super sugary sweet. 

It's dark and sexy and not too snobby. A plus. The upstairs room we had reserved (but lacked a bartender for the evening) would've been an additional star, I'm sure of it. Who picked up the trail of thirsty drunks? Noelle. 

Noelle is quite possibly the most enchanting, sweet and productive bartender I've seen in the country. Whoever hired her and keeps her happy as an Owl Tree employee should be rewarded. She's a gem. 

I got pretty drunk, ending in a gimlet that commanded attention. That's all.
author: Colleen C.

description:
For me, it was like meeting with a long lost friend and discoverying she's had a Heidi Montag-style makeover -- over the top and cheesy.  Just before we left San Francisco, we had tried to stop by one of our favorite dive bars in the city.  It was closed. Fast forward three years, and we learned that the owner had died, the owls donated to a library (??) and now it's all glammed up, pumping music and attracting a douche-y B&T crowd, courtesy of the son. Perhaps I'm being harsh and should accept change as it comes, but I remain nostalgic. 

At least they've kept the snacks. Somewhere, the soul of the owl is hovering.
author: Vanessa H.

description:
I don't always pick the best thing off of the menu, but when I do, I'm going to broadcast it to the world via Yelp.

Two words: Mango Mojito. 

I'd definitely come back for Happy Hour and the complimentary endless cheese n' crackers and pastrami. Although it was loud in our particular corner, I'm going to attribute it to the fervor of a giants game happening a few miles away.

Also, I'm determined to find out where the back stairs lead. I got distracted by the platter of aforementioned cheese n' crackers and pastrami.
author: Furai X.

description: Casual corner bar with a fair draft beer selection and good cocktails. Kinda dark, not fancy or uppity but also definitely not a dive. Honestly, it's that simple- if you are just looking for a chill but not old or boring bar, this place hits the mark. Not too big but there are tables. Cocktails are strong- we had dark and stormy, lychee pineapple martini, mango mojito and blood orange margarita through course of evening. Mango mojito was the best.
author: Farheen Q.

description:
Grand reopening TODAY at 5pm!

update

I am so happy to see the Owl Tree reopened! finally  I watched the Owl Tree transform every day (I live down the street) .  First, they gutted the place then they did outside plumbing, then they put new walls, floor, sealing, light fixtures and tiles on the outside wall....  They kept their original bar counter.  I think they did really good job with the new decor.  I really like their wide dark wood panels on the wall, nice square sealing treatment with chandelierish lighting and outside owl tile work.  (I posted pictures)

Only thing is they lost their "dive bar" feel.  The price for the drinks went up (See the pictures of drink menu I posted).  They lost cozy dark owl's nest feel...They put all the owl collection in a glass case near the stairs... Good thing is they have better wine selections including my favorite J Pinot Noir.  They suppose to start to serve appetizer such as salamis and cold plates soon.

The new owner Rick Howard and George Karas who also own Harry's Bar and Bruno's dropped "C Bobby's" and now the bar is called "Owl Tree".   I really like the new owners.

FYI They are opening up their upstairs very soon.
author: Chie J.

description:
Funky and very cool!  My new watering hole!

I stopped here for a drink before having sushi next door at Sakana.  Owl Tree is a random bar without the random crowd.  I ordered the Ketel One Grayhound.  Dee-lish.  I'm definitely coming back for happy hour!
author: Eddie L.

description: Awesome small bar in the city.  The bar has darker lightening and big leather booths that were really comfy.  We stopped in for happy hour and the drink prices were decent.  The bar was pretty busy for the NBA Finals game, but the service was attentive for our large group.  They offered free cheese and crackers during happy hour, which was a nice snack.  I will surely be back next time I am in town.
author: Katrina D.

description: Small, dark, upscale dive bar. Cool enough environment. Giving it 3 stars because I absolutely HATE when you order a whiskey coke and the give you expensive whiskey instead of giving the cheap well stuff, or asking at the very least!
author: Chris B.

description: I live close to the Owl Tree so it's handy to go there for a drink. I generally get good drinks. A few times they have been terrible but I haven't seen those bar tenders since. I do have to give it full stars though for the awesome people who work there.
author: Amy W.

description: Very cozy dive joint in the TL.  Drink prices are what you'd expect for SF, but they have a list of some pretty tasty tailored cocktails.  Full bar, and a few brews on tap.  I love the diversity here, and the bartenders were all pretty nice.  Definitely don't have to dress to impress, so come here if you are looking for more of a low key, laid back night.
author: David C.

description: The wife and I had a drink here before our meal at Fleur de Lys.   They make a pretty solid Hendrick's Gin Martini.   My wife went with the Woodford Reserve Manhattan.    It's a smallish bar but it's got lots of character and the bartender was very good.   They had an assortment of cheeses and salami to munch on during Happy Hour.    All in all a nice place to get a drink.   As others have said, it's also nice that it's not packed.
author: David O.

description: 5 August..... waiting outsid at 410 pm.....the bar was supposed to open at 4.00 pm........  the door was still  locked..... the barman was behind the bar.... looked at me then carried on doing what he was doing. Went down the road for a drink.
author: Marvin S.

description:
Every once in while during my travels I come across a place I love so much that I would want to pack it up and take it home with me so I can become a regular there. The Owl Tree joins that list for me. It's cozy with exposed brick walls and dim lighting and the bartenders are very nice eye-candy. So were some of the patrons the night I was there come to think of it. They have a great jukebox, just enough cocktails on their menu to keep it interesting, and a nice mixture of regulars and newcomers, high class and lowbrow people to make it fun.

It is a little pricy for me, but most things are when I'm visiting this city because of my comparison and they don't serve food. But, they do serve snack mix and have no qualms about you bringing food in if you're starving and waiting to meet up with your friends for dinner.
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Sexy bar, reasons cited below:
Blood orange margaritas.
Purse hooks (such a convenience).
Hot, hot jams.
Bartender with accent.
Complimentary bowl of snacks.

See...sexy.
author: Katie B.

description:
Came upon this place by accident really. We were going to check out another bar around the corner, but they wouldn't let us in because my boyfriend wasn't "up to dress code" (which is BS, they let in another guy before us who was dressed in pretty much the same outfit...if you're going to have a dress code, you need to enforce it for everyone!).  We decided to try this bar since it was right there, and it was definitely a good choice!

We got there a little before 10 on a Friday night and it was already starting to get crowded.  We had to wait a bit for a place to sit and enjoy our drinks.  The downside to this bar is that it is pretty tiny (I think the capacity sign said like 70 people or something) so if you aren't sitting down, you definitely have people knocking into you trying to get from the entrance to the back of the bar, and it gets HOT if you aren't sitting near the door or a window.  This place has some nice "mood lighting" going on, and the music was audible but not too loud.  

The bartender is awesome!  My friend wasn't sure what she wanted, so she asked him to surprise her with a drink that had Baileys in it, lemme tell you she was NOT disappointed.  I ended up getting one for myself later!  I have to give him credit for being so quick as he is the only bartender it seems and still have the drinks turn out great, nice and strong and not watered down!  Fun place to grab a drink and start a night out in the city, will definitely be back at this place in the future!
author: Alyssa L.

description:
I'm a firm believer that everything happens for a reason. And I truly believe that my colleagues and I were meant to find Owl Tree!

Rewind back to Monday night. Wandering the Mission, looking for a cool bar (but not too cool or pretentious) that might serve food. Our initial destination was closed for a private party (and I'm sort of glad about this, as we went there another night and it wasn't so great), so we were just taking stock of the joints in the neighborhood. 

After coming to the conclusion that most divey bars in this neck of the woods don't serve food, we settled on Owl Tree. The sign outside looked promising and I like owls. Almost got a owl tattoo on my bum around Halloween time. I took this as a sign.

So glad we stopped in! Fell in love with the cocktail menu right away. Who could resist a blood orange margarita? FYI- blood orange is the new bacon. They also serve bubbly by the glass as well as Blue Moon on tap. The bartender even allowed me to bring in a spider roll from next door! Now you're speaking my language...

The best part about Owl Tree was the jams! Amazing tunage for sure. We definitely heard "Shots", "Meet Me at the Hotel" and quite possibly some Rhianna. Having too much fun to Shazam every song that came on. I was a little sad to leave to grab dinner, but it was time to go. Let someone else discover this little gem! 

I heart you, Owl Tree! Hope that we stumble upon each other again soon. If it's meant to be, of course!
author: Abby S.

description:
I've stayed at the Hotel Monaco across the street so many times that they greet me by name in the elevator. I'm not sure why it took me so long to find the Owl Tree, but better late than never!

A friendly bartender, impressive drink list (I can hear their blood orange margarita calling my name even in Chicago), and uhmazing music (thanks to the juke box).

Now that I've discovered it I have a feeling the folks at Owl Tree may start greeting me by name too!
author: Andrea R.

description: From the outside, you're not sure what you're gonna get.  Step inside and its a little posh & classy...not much, just enough.  Staff is super friendly...they even laughed when I apologized for my european friends who weren't tipping.
author: David S.

description: Cool atmosphere. Cold drinks, good pricing. It got a little douchy when a group of "hot shot" lawyer, wall street, type guys came in. But other than that, the crowd was pretty cool.
author: Mike C.

description:
They have Jameson on tap. 

We went for exactly that reason- they have whiskey, on tap. How cool is that? It does taste a bit different too. It seemed a bit more up front than Jameson from a bottle, maybe a bit fresher and younger. 

And I can say that I did taste a difference because despite always asking for Jameson, neat, from the tap, we were always served with Jameson from the bottle. Finally, one time we called the bartender out on it, and said that we came for and ordered the Jameson on tap, could we have some of that please. It took all of a quarter of a second longer. 

Its a cool bar inside- lots of dark wood, comfortable seating. Plenty of people around, and an odd selection of music playing, but not loud or crowded to the point where you couldn't sit around a table and make easy conversation all night over round after round of Jameson. 

My issue came when I went to close my tab. They way overcharged us. By about 40%. Of course, your chances of disputing a tab at a crowded bar at 1:30 on a Saturday night are nonexistant. So we just paid, and I won't be coming back again, despite the cool setting, and the awesome Jameson tap.
author: Preston P.

description:
Feeling kinda lazy so here goes:
Dark, small, don't stand in between tables and bar area if there are no seats because it is awkward, cozy booths, good cocktails. Done.
author: Raul S.

description:
A friend of mine told me about this place and how great it was, he was not wrong.  The ambiance at the bar is pretty mellow, well for happy hour anyway.  It supposedly gets a little rowdy later in the night.

The service was fantastic and the bartender working there, when I went, was on top of everything.  She was able to get drink orders, make drinks, and get these drinks to everyone extremely quickly.  Also, they had free snacks for each table that they kept re-filling, which was really nice.  I can't remember what their happy hour prices were, but they were a good deal.  I would definitely go to this place if I was in the neighborhood.
author: Dipesh G.

description: Loved this bar. Had some arvo beers after a day out. The bar staff were great and really friendly. We got some tips for other good bars and breakfast spots. Worth a visit.
author: Trevor A.

description:
This is an interesting little bar; I was very surprised to see that they have Jameson on tap! I've never seen such a thing! 

 The bartenders were all very friendly; the crowd varied a little from night to night but all-in-all it seemed like a pretty awesome "regular" bar to hang out at.
author: Jeremy S.

description:
*********************** 673 **************************

          Happy Hour 4-7 PM, sweet! Came here before hitting my FAV spot Sons & Daughters again. Owl Tree is way off Union Square tourist trap, the place is simply cool! Decor in dark Mahogany wood, really red carpet, I feel like a celeb!!! Black leather booths offer a classy, yet hip with all the owls!! 

         Owl Tree bar is a a few rare bars in San Francisco offer 7 days a week HAPPY HOUR! $3 draft beers, $4 well cocktails and $1 off all beers, wines and cocktails. FREE cheese and crackers, also love their mixed snacks! 

          A perfect place to swing by for a cocktail or 2 or 3 after work, wait I don't have a job, OK so come by when they open! Manhattan martini, Dirty martini or Lychee martini will do me any time of day! They offer sparkling by the glass too, not bad!

        Cool spot, unpretentious, and good cocktails!
author: Manda Bear B.

description:
Try margarita
Made of orange vampire blood
Listen to the owl
author: Jonathan C.

description:
For a week, I'd been walking past this place while staying at Hotel Monaco on Geary/Taylor, saying: "That place looks like a dump. Who'd ever want to drink there?" Well, I should know better than to judge a book by it's cover in San Francisco, as I couldn't have been more wrong about this place.

On the outside, there's this smarmy looking mosaic owl that greets you. Perhaps because I walked by in the morning hours and it was crawling with undesirables begging for change right outside the front door, I formed the opinion that it was a total poop hole. But upon scoping the TL for a place to cap off the night, a friend and I decided to head inside and give it a shot.

It reminds me of the awkward, semi-attractive girl from high school. You'd see her every day, think she was interesting... but because she wore bright, baggy clothes, you never thought twice about how she looked naked. Then somewhere down the line, you run into her at the local coffee shop wearing nothing but a pair of Reebok workout pants and a sports bra... and you realize that she's a total babe with delicious curves and an onion booty to match. That's Owl Tree. 

The inside of the bar is totally chic. Dark colors, exposed bricks, fancy bar stools, an upscale crowd, and more! I'd have never guessed this was how the inside looked based on the exterior of the building.

The specialty drinks were a bit on the pricey side and they were slightly above-average for my tastes. After trying one gin gimlet, I stuck with beer, which was fine by me.

If you get a chance, check out the 2nd floor. It's private and it'd make for a GREAT birthday spot. Holds up to 50 and has it's own bar. w00t!
author: Ruggy J.

description:
I like the low key vibe of this place that's surprisingly nice for the TL (since it's been remodeled) and the novelty of having Jameson on tap. There's a good selection of beers and liquor, a very nice private room upstairs that opens at 9pm. There's no reservation fee for the whole upstairs room but $1000 bar minimum; just reserve some tables if you're starting after 9. You can also reserve tables downstairs if you call ahead - I prefer the booth in the back.

Happy Hour 4-7pm features $1 off everything and snacks (cheese, crackers, dried meats)!
author: Kristina A.

description: Stopped in for a quick drink with friends at this tiny spot.  We sat at a tiny booth, enjoyed a delicious cocktail, and the atmosphere, then headed back to the hotel.  The bartender was quick, friendly, and the ambiance was very cool.  Great way to cap off the night.
author: Kris S.

description: Love the San Fran movies and the fun eclectic crowd. Only 2nd time at the Owl Tree and the bartender Ashley remembered me and said that she was happy to see me again....love the fun 'home town' feel!!!
author: Kimi B.

description:
Came on a Saturday night expecting a bustling crowd. Sad that was not the case.

This is a small two-story bar. The 2nd floor was nice with their big windows along the walls and lounge chairs across the floor. There are bars on both floors, which is convenient.
The cranberry vodkas and martinis were strong, but who's complaining? Could only handle 1 though. Total was ~$25. Blame it on the martini!
author: Candice H.

description:
I love this place! Its right down the street from my apartment and is becoming my new regular meetup w the girls. Plus they have Marc West Pinot which is pretty good :-) 

I love the little booths, and the corner couches, it's dark and the music is always good. Really fun bar, one of my favorite stops to get the night going or for cocktails after work.
author: Jessica C.

description:
Where my hooters at?!

If I'm going to be rolling in a place called Owl Tree, I'd expect to be saturated in the most intense owl motif experience of my life. Besides the glass case tucked away by the back staircase and the glass booth partitions, there is no other bird presence in the bar. Why so shy? Show me hooting hooters!

Some may consider the decor classy. I consider it false advertising.
author: Suany W.

description:
DO NOT GO HERE! Especially if you don't have Cali ID. 

Came in this place to have a drink with a friend while visiting from NV, and I was DENIED because the very rude bartender said he couldn't tell if my ID was real!! SERIOUSLY! I've been drinking all over this city with my REAL ID that shows that I'm clearly over 21. He just bent it like it wasn't real and asked for another form of ID, and then just told me he can refuse service to anyone. This guy and one other man spent several minutes looking under a black light and doing who knows what trying to read my REAL ID. These guys clearly have no idea how to check IDs, and I wouldn't be surprised if this place was crawling with underage drinkers. My friends ID was from Washington state, still turned vertical, and was practically expired. I'm thinking the ID may not have been the only reason I was denied service... Oh well. The drinks were over priced anyways. It was dark, and not inviting. Just.. Don't even waste your time here.
author: Mariah B.

description:
Picturesque of a Gentleman's hideout.

It's small but comfortable for a night cap.  I say this because I went here with 3 guy friends and we squished in a booth around 12  midnight for exactly that. It was very calming.

Personally, I wouldn't  hang out here but If I was a man post break-up this would be far less pathetic then the actual "NITECAP" on O' Farrell. 

 I'm not even sure  if that is a just comparison.
author: Hannah A.

description: Love, love, love. My friends love coming here, and now so do I! It's a small space, but it's got that classic 50's style sultry dark lounge look while staying modern and clean. No dirty floors or dirty old men. Happy hour is great- they serve salami, cheese, and crackers, and they've got a few big open booths/seating areas where a large group can get together. Prices are very fair for in the city :) It's a small space, so you'll get cozy at the busier hours and I've met lots of new friendly people. Not a dancing lounge, but a great get together and catch up lounge. A perfect place to meet after work or launch you evening out!
author: Amanda P.

description: I went there on Thanksgiving evening and the place was full.  Anjela, the bartender, is cute, fun , and makes excellent drinks would definitely recommend this place for a drink after a long day.
author: George B.

description: This is a late post. I came here a few months ago. We wanted to go to a chill place to have a few drinks. We didn't want to hear fist pumping music. It's more like a dive bar. The drinks were on point. Price was just right. The reason why Im giving it 4 stars is because it only has one restroom. :( There was only one bartender but he managed to handle the crowd extremely well. I will be coming back. Oh.. and a must try the "Blood Orange Margarita" DELICIOUS!!
author: Marlene G.

description: Came last night and I dig the music and service. The only thing I don't like is the crowd. But the bartender and bar back was so nice and very attentive. I didn't drink but they were on top of my friends refills. I liked the overall experience of this place.
author: Abbie F.

description: Nice cheap and strong drinks. Very good atmosphere, can be hard to get a place to sit, but later on during the evening its not that bad
author: Ida R.

description:
Happy hour with $3.00 drafts and 4$ wells! Good deal! 

A very casual and cozy setting- a great place to just sit and chit chat with friends. 
Definitely up to come back here again for happy hour!
author: Eileen Z.

description:
This place was fun!  I visited San Fran for the weekend and went to dinner down the road.  I was actually drawn to this place because of the fun neon sign out front and I'm kinda digging owls these days. 

Had a few drinks ... the Blackberry Martini was awesome.  The bartender was great ... I would go there again in a heartbeat!
author: Stacy W.

description: We stopped here after dinner because it looked fun. This place is so cute! The bartender was so incredibly friendly and sweet! The music was great and the ambience is fun! It seems like it would be a great place to grab drinks after work! If you are staying near Union Square or live in SF, check this fun bar out!
author: emily w.

description: I love this bar for after work. It always has free snacks and great service. No pretentiousness. And always a fair price for a great cocktail. I especially like Mondays for a fernet and a high life for $7 if your in the biz.
author: Jake E.

description:
So I hear this place used to look like the love child of an owl enthusiast and a hoarder.

Today - it's stayin' quite classy. Typical dimly lit, pleather, dark red velvet, mirrors and brass kinda joint.

The drinks are good. I dig that they have pub mix.

Sweet spot to lay low and grab a beer.

OH and they ONLY play movies on the TVs that are based in SF. I thought that was all adorable. :)
author: Pamela R.

description:
This is one of my favorites in the new 'hood.

I've heard it was much more divey before the remodel, but I never saw it then. Now, it's hip, but not too hip. Divey, but not too divey. It's also got friendly staff and free munchies. Can't complain about that. It is a bit on the pricey side ($18 for two glasses of very tasty red wine) but it's a really great place to hang out.
author: Kim C.

description:
I came here 2 nights in a row. The first night was a Thursday night and the second night, duh, a Friday night. I judged this place by the outside and had decided it was probably douchey. But I ended up really liking it! I'm not a fan of the collared shirt crowd, and yeah, about half the population had collars, but it wasn't annoying at all! The spikey haired men in the collared pin striped shirts maintained decorum. The drinks were a bit pricey but the classy environment and convenient location to my home made up for my pricey drinks. I had a few of their $10 Cazedores blood orange margaritas and plan on having more in the future. Quite tasty. 

Bonus! I guess there is an upstairs room that you can reserve for private parties. If you sit facing the stair case you get to watch drunk girls fall down the stairs!!!! It's fantastic!! I watched a girl eat shit and it made my night. Not because she got hurt, which she didn't (or at least she pretended not to be in pain) but it's always funny to see a dressed up girl lack grace and get really embarrassed about it. Hypocrite? Yeah. I've totally been there. And I hope whoever witnessed it laughed! 
Anyways, if you are feeling pretty and don't wanna waste your perfect makeup artistry at Ha-Ra, then head over to Owl Tree. And if you just aren't feelin like drinking to Morrissey or The Ting Tings and want to indulge in some Top 40 from 1998-2009, then get your ass over to Owl tree and stop pretending to be such a hipster!
author: Liz M.
